item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Find insights on Freenet, Searchlight Capital Partners’and British Columbia Investment Management, Audioboom, and more featured in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on California’s electricity-bill plan, John Wood Group, and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

item.title: McCarthy Says House GOP Plans to Vote on Debt Limit, Spending Cuts
item.description: The House speaker said Republicans want to put limits on federal spending and require Americans to work to receive federal benefits.

item.title: Apple Launches High-Yield Savings Account
item.description: Apple Card credit-card holders can open accounts with a 4.15% annual percentage yield.

item.title: How I Rediscovered The Joy of Reading in Retirement
item.description: Having more free time has given me a kind of connection with books that I haven’t had since I was a little girl. But the experience hasn’t been what I expected.

item.title: Microsoft Could Inflate Google's Mobile Search Toll
item.description: Google’s search margins would face pressure if it now has to bid against Microsoft for default status on mobile devices from Samsung and Apple.

item.title: Treasury Yields Rise As Markets Price In Another Hike
item.description: Treasury yields rose as investors see the Federal Reserve increasing interest rates at least one more time this year.

item.title: Bosses Pay Workers to Move Closer to Offices
item.description: Job postings in the U.S. that mention relocation benefits were up nearly 75% as of February.

item.title: America's Most Prolific Logger Recasts Itself as Environmental Do-Gooder
item.description: Weyerhaeuser uses new climate math to court green investors, while cutting down as many trees as ever.

item.title: David's Bridal Will Close All Stores in Chapter 11 Unless Buyer Emerges
item.description: America’s largest bridal retailer files for bankruptcy to continue marketing itself for sale.

item.title: What Ever Happened to the 'Need to Know'?
item.description: High-profile leaks suggest it isn’t enforced at the Pentagon.

item.title: Shop Class Brought Life Lessons and a Respite
item.description: Everything goes back to its place.

item.title: Stocks Waver as Investors Weigh Higher Rates
item.description: The S&P 500 and bond yields edged higher as investors braced for a busy week of earnings.

item.title: What Is the Environmental Cost of an EV?
item.description: The outcome has been predetermined, but the strategic plan to get there is evolving on the go.

item.title: Woke Companies Have Been With Us for a Long Time
item.description: At least we used to prefer race- and sex-blind résumés.

item.title: Pacific Ocean Garbage Patch Is Bursting With Life
item.description: Biologists who fished toothbrushes, rope and broken bottle shards from the patch found them studded with gooseneck barnacles and jet-black sea anemones.

item.title: Nielsen Regains Key Media Accreditation
item.description: The TV ratings giant’s seal of approval had been suspended by the Media Rating Council since 2021.

item.title: Remember When Doctors and Patients Made Eye Contact?
item.description: I am being asked to do the equivalent of texting while driving.

item.title: Give Me an Employee of the Month
item.description: The most reliable lawyers had real-life work experience, often as a teen, before passing the bar.

item.title: Russian Court Sentences Putin Critic Kara-Murza to 25 Years
item.description: Vladimir Kara-Murza’s sentence is the longest to be handed to a Russian opposition figure since the war in Ukraine began in February last year.
